Description: Shoulder sherd of East Greek (North Ionian) Late Wild Goat (black-figured) pottery krater; handle scar at break on right, probably from ring handle; interior: painted band at top of sherd; exterior: cream slip; shoulder glazed with incised lotus flower with added red and white; below, animal frieze: two lions (partly preserved) attacking a boar facing left; filling ornaments: rosettes and half rosettes; incision used for the outline and for details of animals. Slightly burnt.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 54)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.512)
